comment.author: 77155450@N04
comment._content:
Likely to be Charles Victor Booth, Captain in the Suffolk Regiment.
Born Elmswell Suffolk in 1886, died in Sussex in 1947
Service Record in National Archives, reference WO 339/53722

comment.author: 44062536@N02
comment._content: Capt CV Booth, Suffolk Regt, later RAF

comment.author: 44062536@N02
comment._content: Yes... must be only on one CV Booth in the Suffolk Regt; later in the RAF & LC according to his Medal Roll Index Card

comment.author: 77788549@N05
comment._content:
Temporary Captain C V Booth, serving with a Service Battalion, is recorded as appointed to be a Temporary Captain in the Suffolk Regiment on 15th June 1916, with seniority from 23rd April 1915, in the London Gazette of 23rd June 1916.

He is shown as resigning his commission in the Army, still a Captain, wef 2nd November 1918, on appointment to the RAF, published in the London Gazette of 29th November 1918.

comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content: Charles Victor Booth (1887-1947) was 3rd of 6 children born to Benjamin Brodie Booth (1853-1914) and Louisa Ridley (1853-1932). records.ancestry.com/Louisa_Ridley_records.ashx?pid=30511094 This record gives birth date for his brother Donald Ridley Booth as 1887; he was actually born 1888 as per FreeBMD.org.uk

comment.author: 64288588@N05
comment._content: Charles Victor Booth of Redroof, Beresford Gardens, Cliftonville, Kent. Died 23 Feb 1947 at 6 Station Road, Portslade-by-Sea, Sussex. Probate granted to Dorothy Robina Booth, Widow.
